summary: This is a scheduling order from Judge Alison J. Nathan in the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell. It sets deadlines for pretrial disclosures, motions, and other procedures, with a provisional trial commencement date of July 12, 2021.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case for which this scheduling order is issued.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge presiding over the case who issued this scheduling order.

events.title: Court Conference
events.description: A conference was held where the court considered the defendant's request for a continuance.

events.title: Provisional Trial Commencement Date
events.description: The court provisionally set this as the trial start date, pending resolution of the defendant's continuance request.

locations: United States District Court Southern District of New York
keyFacts: The court issued a detailed pretrial schedule for the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell.
The schedule includes deadlines for expert witness disclosures, pretrial motions related to new S2 indictment charges, and disclosure of alleged victims.
The court provisionally set July 12, 2021, as the trial commencement date, pending a decision on the defendant's request for a continuance.
The order references an 'S2 indictment,' indicating a superseding indictment with new charges.
The parties are ordered to confer on the government's proposal for early submission of defense witness statements under Federal Rule of Criminal Procedure 26.2.
